oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William E. Lane, a Sevier County farmer, about "troublesome times"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his mother, Lane writes "the rebbels have taken most all that I have made by farming." A heartfelt letter from Lane to his mother discussing his losses and deprivations from the war and thanking her for taking care of his wife and boy. Lane's farm may have been in that area of southern Jefferson County that later became part of Sevier County.
